Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great view, wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: hannahytaylor
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here and thoroughly enjoyed it! We had the Red Room, which faces the water (not the Grand Canal, but darn close) with a wonderful, long balcony. It's a suite, and was plenty big enough for the 4 of us (2 kids slept togeter in the sofa bed). You are a 5 minute walk from San Marcos and there is a vaparatto stop right in front of the hotel. The hotel also has it's own dock, so very easy getting to/from airport or train station as water taxi can take you right to the hotel door--a real plus! The front desk staff was extremely helpful with restaurant recommendations, reservations, directions, sightseeing tips. Breakfast each morning, included in the rate, was lovely, adn we also received a free glass of Prosecco in the bar :) It's not cheap, but then again, nothing in Venice is! It was great just to be able to relax and watch it all go by from the balcony. I would definitely return to the Vivaldi!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: marie p
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel two weeks ago for 2 nights. This was our first time to Venice and since we had only a short time there, I wanted a hotel that was near all the sights. I researched a lot of hotels and I am so glad that I selected this hotel. From the moment we arrived by boat from the airport, the service was excellent. The staff was very helpful, provided us with a map and suggestions on where to eat and how to get around. Our room was very nice with a separate sitting area, large bathroom and the room was very clean. They gave us a complimentary cocktail which we enjoyed on the rooftop terrace. There is an incredible view on the terrace and in the warm weather it must be nice to sit outside and relax. The hotel provides you with an excellent breakfast of eggs, cereals, rolls, meats, juices, pastries and coffee. The hotel also provides a complimentary shuttle to Murano, the glass factory where you watch them make the glass and then you can walk around the town. The hotel suggested that we also see Burano and told us how to use the water taxi. It was a nice trip and very easy to do.This hotel is about 2 blocks from San Marco, so you can walk everywhere. Venice is a beautiful city and this is a great hotel. I definitely look forward to staying here again on my next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: RonO-in-CA
Reviews.Content: We found everything in Venice to be quite expensive, so value is very relative. You do pay a premium for hotels close to San Marco, but Locanda Vivaldi was definitely worth the premium. Rooms are a bit small (but that is typical for Venice), but nicely decorated and quaint. Service was excellent...from the complimentary bottle of prosecco when we checked in, to the welcome drinks on the beautiful terrace (excellent views), to the friendly breakfast servers. Included breakfast was quite good, especially the chocolate croissants :P Front desk was very accommodating when we asked if it was possible to have a room with a view...he gave us a corner room which still had stunning views of San Grigorio Maggiore. Stone's throw from all the main attractions in San Marco. Good restaurants just a short walk away. Even a gym just around the corner where we managed to negotiate a 3 visit pass for our 1 week stay in Venice. Would definitely come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: S C
Reviews.Content: We went for a special birthday, my husband, three children and I. We ALL thought the Locanda Vivaldi was wonderful The staff are friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was great as we didn't need to use public transport which we found expensive and slow. The breakfast was generous and fresh. The rooms were immaculate and very spacious. The family room had two bathrooms, which was a definite bonus, and a lovely little terrace. We were lucky as the rooftop terrace was open because the weather was good, and the view is really lovely! We didn't find the location too noisy, despite being so central. It was actually very convenient, as we didn't have to lug our suitcases too far at all. All in all our stay was perfect, and the Locanda Vivaldi had a great deal to do with that!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Adrian Ross
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews, I am afraid that I and my friends have to disagree with some of the praise. The hotel is an old building on the Grand Canal near the Vaporetto station. As such it is ideally positioned for St Marks Square and transport. There is noise from the large numbers of tourists going from the boats to the centre but this dies down around 9 pm. However, the rooms although large have small bathrooms which are in some need of refurbishment. The room maid failed to replace shampoo etc on 3 of 4 days and did not replace towels on one day. This was resolved with a word at the desk. The public areas have gone beyond being typical of a Venice palazzio to dowdy and having stayed in other Venice hotels of a similar grade, the hotel is in need of an update whilst maintaining the character. Breakfast is in 2 small rooms and on the days we were there, the pleasant staff could not keep up with the guests. Tables were uncleared, the bread and other food ran out and the 2 rooms were completely full. The restaurant is on the top floor and on the 2 occasions we went up there it was empty. There is really no pretence that this is meant to be a quality restaurant as it appears to available only to guests. There are several other hotels nearby charging the same rates, in the same sort of building that offer a much better facilities and value. Reception staff were helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blottoinnyc
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, very nice location for a first visit. Close to St. Marks, but far enough away to not feel crushed. Next time I will stay father away from the maddening crowds.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel within a Jewel”
Reviews.Author: jnette613
Reviews.Content: Suggested by a friend we were more than delighted with this wonderful boutique hotel. We had a room overlooking the Grand Canal, our friends a corner room overlooking both the Canal and a smaller waterway- perhaps a better choice as the front-facing room did get a little noisy due to some enthusiastic tourist. Of course not enough to interfere with the joy of our stay. The staff were friendly, informative and always welcoming. Asking their suggestion for dinner we enjoyed several Trattorias quite close to the Hotel, delicious! Situated close to the water-taxi, St. Marks Square, many wonderful galleries and tourist attractions it made our trip to Venice very easy to enjoy. Gracias, we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Small, Friendly, Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoVTHokieTraveler
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is beautifully situated on the Grand Canal and within easy walking distance from St. Marks Square. The staff was friendly, very helpful and spoke perfect English. We wanted a dinner reservation at a certain restaurant; they called many times to make the reservation. The room was a luxury room by any standards - truly Venetian with linen sheets! We had a junior suite that had a heavy "curtain" we could drop to separate the sleeping areas with each having their own TV! The bathroom was huge and had every convenience - from jets for the shower and tub to the ability to switch the electrical outlets from European to US voltage! The breakfast buffet was excellent! All in all, the Locanda Vivaldi is a perfect place to make your stay in Venice all it is suppose to be!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, Comfortable, Classy and Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: downhillgeoger
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at Locanda Vivaldi by water taxi (â‚¬110 organised at the desk in the arrivals hall to avoid late night haggling) we felt welcome. All the members of staff were unfailingly helpful and friendly, happy to book water taxis, make dinner reservations and answer what must seem like the inevitable tourist questions. We took the courtesy trip to Murano to watch glass blowing â€“ amazingly skilled - felt under no obligation to buy anything, enjoyed the glass museum and then the return journey by water bus via areas of the city we would not otherwise have seen. Our room (209) was Italian in style, - as it should be in Venice - scrupulously clean with a very comfortable bed, crisp white bed linen, very well appointed en-suite shower room and soft, fluffy towels changed every day. The room was tidied while we were at dinner, sweets and a card with the weather forecast for the following day left on our pillows. The breakfast buffet was excellent, extensive and constantly replenished. Temperatures in February can be chilly, but the heating system was easily adjusted to either heat or cool the room. Locanda Vivaldi is centrally located on Riva Degli Schiavoni, four minutes walk from the Piazza San Marco . We walked to a restaurant near the Rialto in 15 minutes and to another near the Arsenale in five. We tried other good restaurants in the little streets behind the hotel. Opposite is the San Zaccaria water bus stop. Room 209 has a view of the lagoon, overlooks Riva Dei Greciâ€™s traditional Venetian apartments and provides a fascinating glimpse of the comings and goings of the carabinieri from the police station opposite. Fans of Donna Leonâ€™s books will realise that the Questura is further up this canal. At this time of year the streets empty quickly in the evenings and nights were noise free. From around six Venice begins to waken up. Water buses and other boats come and go with varying degrees of noise. That is Venice and the inevitable result of overlooking a pretty canal, the iconic lagoon and being so conveniently close to a vaporetto stop.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: oldgolfers
Reviews.Content: would not hesitate to reccomend this small hotel ideally situatedd friendly staff very very clean fresh towels every day and a wonderful breakfast next time in Venice I will hope to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephief
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely weekend at the Vivaldi hotel it was just close enough to St Marks to be in the heart of things but not so close that it was noisy. The hotel itself was lovely, not huge, with a nice bar, beautiful views and very pretty comfortable rooms. Breakfast was excellent. We would love to stay there again, next time we will splash out and go for the top of the range room with the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Live like a king, stay at Antonin Vivaldi's former home”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworld012
Reviews.Content: We happened to visit Venice during the annual Regatta and had a very difficult time finding a reasonably priced place to stay. By default we found a room here, and negotiated the room price down by 50 euros (still very expensive), but we had an incredible view of the Giudecca Canal and the lagoon since the hotel was right on the edge of the water. We had a 3rd floor corner room and because of this, had 2 windows facing the grand promenade and 3 windows facing the lagoon. The room was very spacious, filled with antique furniture and artwork so we had the impression of living like Louis XIV. Our bathroom was as big as some hotel rooms in Italy. The very old hotel has some of the best energy efficiency upgrades, such as you have to insert your room card in a wall slot to get the lights and power in the room to work. Needless to say the room was extremely comfortable with slippers and robes provided. Late night we bought a bottle of wine, sat on our balcony, people watched on the promenade. We awoke to see the Regatta unfolding before our eyes from our hotel windows. Included in the room price was a free drink at the rooftop bar/restaurant and a very lavish breakfast spread. Very pricey room but if you want to live it up once in your Italian trip I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “big rooms”
Reviews.Author: kamal459
Reviews.Content: The reception staff, especially Tomasso was very helpful. He was very prompt with answering our emails before we travelled. We had requested a large room and this was provided. It was a pleasant surprise to find ourselves almost in a small suite with a separate bedroom and sitting area. All our requested specifications were met with. The location was superb, 2 mins from San Marco square. The restaurant was good. We were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary and they gave us a complimentary bottle of wine. The special taxi service from the airport and to the railway station was also very comfortable. A good experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Service & location great”
Reviews.Author: peterj552
Reviews.Content: Mentioned our silver wedding on the booking & was presently supprised to be upgraded to their double superior room overlooking the lagoon, plus a bottle of bubbly.Staff very helpful, breakfast very good, location excellent, jacuzzi bath a real bonus - Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Honoria1
Reviews.Content: We went to the biennale at the end of October and took out three teenage daughters. We booked two rooms on the first floor facing the water near each other - they had a corner bedroom with a balcony and we had I think a superior double. It is indeed noisy on the front but the view is worth it. We couldn't have air con switched on ( I asked but it had to be controlled by the reception?) so the second night we slept with the window closed and the shutters down. This was probably not a bad thing as we were bitten by Mosquitos in the room (found and killed). I only mention this (not the hotels fault of course!)as I would never have thought to travel with repellent/bite stuff at the end of October and want to pass on the info. The breakfast room is quite dark,self service food ok-ish but instant coffee terrible. I went into the kitchen and saw a gaggia Machine and realised that one has to ask for an espresso to get a decent cup in the morning which we did. The staff are all very pleasant but I think they should throw another person at the breakfast room to improve service which was unbelievably slow eg our hot drinks didn't arrive until we had finished breakfast on both mornings. The room was clean, bathroom compact but clean and well stocked, good towels /heated rails etc. We enjoyed our complimentary Bellini watching the sun go down on our first night. The food in the roof top restaurant was adequate..we only ate there as we were al rather overtired. The best thing about the hotel was the location...if you are only in Venice for a couple of nights this is where you want to be. Another note...we checked out and my daughter told a member of staff that she had lost her sunglasses in the room. When we came back at 3pm to take out private water taxi back to the airport they had found her glasses and put them with her luggage. Much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Venice Jewel”
Reviews.Author: magnolia65
Reviews.Content: In searching the internet for a good hotel in Venice, I felt like I was really taking a gamble never having been to Italy, but, wow, did we ever find a jewel! Being a classical musician, I noticed the name 'Vivaldi' in the name of the hotel, and then learned it was his house at one time--had been made into a hotel. Kept hoping he would haunt us at night with his music, but he did not. The staff was very courteous and helpful, room(s)-superior double suite on 3rd floor, with its own balcony was gorgeous!!! One of the most beautiful hotels I have ever seen. Comes with breakfast which was lovely. Location, location, location--we four ladies liked the fact that it was just before the Grand Canal, on the lagoon, just not the noise that we would have had. Within waking distance of EVERYTHING! Oh, we were a little concerned with safety in Venice--opened our shutters, looked across the canal, and a policeman waved at me! Police station was there. We stayed there for 3 nights and had a great time. Would highly recommend this hotel to others and would definitely book it again if we ever return.

Reviews.Title: “boutique hotel with a view”
Reviews.Author: gpate_11
Reviews.Content: just come back from 3 nights in venice, stayed at this hotel -paid for and got a double superior room with a view of the lagoon from our bedroom window. The only English channel on the LCD tv was CNN Loved the hotel and it's location. Breakfast was sufficient to keep you full till late afternoon.Loved the vivaldi toiletries. Hotel also provided bathrobes and slippers and at turn down the maid left sweets on your pillow with a card with the weather forecast for the next day. There was a radio in the room which was also linked to the bathroom. Bathroom had powerful shower and a jacuzzi. Just a suggestion to the management seeing that this was formerly Vivaldi's residence- they should give customers the option of Vivaldi's music being played in the room rather then a radio with modern music. The staff were friendly and courteous- had dinner at the hotel on one night-food was reasonable but expensive but then so is venice.

Reviews.Title: “Iconic Venice, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: RJKanno
Reviews.Content: At Locanda Vivaldi, we watched the sunset from their lovely rooftop terrace restaurant that overlooks the Grand Canal and the pedestrian walkway to San Marco. This intimate restaurant is exclusively for guests of Locanda Vivaldi - such a beautiful experience and the food was delightful. We chose Locanda Vivaldi because it has an ideal location on the Grand Canal & close to San Marco. Plus, it has its own private docking entrance for water taxis where you enter through their cozy interior foliage-filled courtyard. Especially nice to have this private docking area when you are loading or unloading your luggage. No need to haul your luggage from a public water stop. Locanda Vivaldi has a variety of room types. We requested a quiet room (did not need to have a view of the Grand Canal) and we were very pleased at how quiet it was. Our room overlooked their interior courtyard and was small but comfortable. Bathroom is modern. The two breakfast rooms are cheery and the buffet breakfast selections plentiful. Service is attentive and very accommodating. Another excellent service was the complimentary 30-minute Internet access from the PC in their comfortable lobby/library. Next time we are in Venice, we will be certain to stay at Locanda Vivaldi again.

Reviews.Title: “Locanda Vivaldi off-key”
Reviews.Author: alison g
Reviews.Content: Took my partner to this hotel for her 60th birthday in October 2011 and it wasn't much of a treat. I paid for a 'superior room' but didn't get one and management wouldn't correct this. Will be taking this matter further with my booking agent. Hotel was clean but it claims to be gay-friendly and it definitely isn't. The staff were most unwelcoming and unhelpful. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wake up and gaze at the Grand Canal!”
Reviews.Author: Regal328
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a fantastic location. Right in the middle of all the action during the day and yet quiet at night. Good size room, great breakfast, helpful staff all went towards making our three night stay a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but dont take the Glass Tour on Offer”
Reviews.Author: VazzaSydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a great location. Friendly staff. Breakfast is nice but the breakfast room was way too hot and uncomfortable so if you have 4 people ask for the 2 tables to be put together in the cooler room.. The reception will offer you a free ride and visit to the glass factory. Note that it is a one way trip if you dont buy anything at the overpriced and pushy factory.

Reviews.Title: “best location to enjoy view of grand canal”
Reviews.Author: tinkobella
Reviews.Content: the rooftop bar/restaurant was the highlight of this hotel. we sat there in late afternoon and enjoyed the city above the crowds. service here was friendly and accommodating. a waiter and a cook take care of everyone and everything very well. hotel reception was a bit prickly when we questioned the rooms we were received vs the ones we purposefully booked. the accommodations are very diverse, so just know what you want. location is very convenient, but the tradeoff is the high tourist and canal traffic. this hotel is charming. great breakfast and well kept rooms. would return.

Reviews.Title: “Vivaldi was great especially location”
Reviews.Author: kimtpcs
Reviews.Content: Perfect stop coming by taxi water bus. Dropped us right there. Room was staring at the Grand Canal, foot traffic bridge and the side canal. Loved our electric roll up shutters and the cleanliness of the room. Breakfast and front desk was very pleasant. The best part is to start and end our day the location was perfect. Rooftop view for cocktails and dinner was also a great surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: LA S
Reviews.Content: We read reviews on Trip Advisor about this hotel and were intrigued by what we read. We booked this hotel and were very happy with our stay. The staff was so very helpful, gracious and kind when we checked in. We were tired from our trip and were thrilled to see a very comfortable room waiting for us. Breakfast each morning was very nice with a great variety of foods. We were able to explore Venice easily from our Hotel. The hotel set up a trip to Murano for us and it was lots of fun. As most tour books tell you, your best way to see Venice is to get lost. Well, we did many times - on purpose - and what a great trip we had. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Sadly not what we had expected.”
Reviews.Author: Shears43
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I travelled to 3 cities from our home in Spain. We notified all the hotels in advance that we had decided to stay with them to celebrate a special wedding anniversary. We visited Florence, Venice and Barcelona and although the hotels in both Florence and Barcelona surprisingly provided us with a wonderful welcome gift this hotel did not. We could, of course, live with this but what we experienced over the course of our 3 night stay was something similar to Fawlty Towers and this was something we could not happily cope with nor expect other guests to do so. For example, breakfast is taken in a room seperated by a double door. The airconditioning is used perhaps for one minute in each five therefore the guests are very uncomfortable as the cooling settings are probably incorrectly programmed. One member of staff is responsible for taking orders, bringing those orders to the table and then clearing them. Needless to say this is time consuming and as a result the food and drink levels are not replenished as he has no time to check such things when the hotel is busy. Members of staff have to change their uniform jacket throughout the day to perform different functions as the hotel is clearly understaffed. The room was clean but small, the bathroom particularly so, and there was a lack of toiletry items left for use by the guest. The shaving mirror was on one side of the bathroom mirror and the shaving point on the other. One had to be a contortionist to be able to use the shaving mirror. We had dinner in the rooftop restaurant on our last evening in Venice and found that although the waiter was polite, as all staff were, he was unaware of the ingredients of the menu items and had to continually ask the chef. The food by the way was excellent. I really do not understand why the daily rate for a room such as the one we occupied should be so excessive.

Reviews.Title: “what a great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: verity m
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend this wonderful hotel, located in the perfect position in venice. They provided a great welcome when we arrived. The room was incredibly comfortable. Nothing was a problem and the ambience and the decor are exceptional. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BobbyNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Locanda Vivaldi for 2 nights in August before our Med cruise. The location of the hotel could not have been any better.We had a fabulous corner room (206) that was large by European standards and that faced the canal. The room and bathroom were very comfortable and clean.The staff was very pleasant and accomodating. Breakfast was basic but good. The roof top terrace was a great location for watching the canal activity at sunset with a bottle of wine ( which was fairly priced)This was my wife's first trip to Venice and when we return to Venice we will be staying at the Locanda.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and pretty venetian hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBabs
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 3 nights and really enjoyed the ambience and position. It is a romantic and quaint property with the prettiest breakfast room I have ever eaten in. It is also well situated just north of Piazza San Marco on the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “heaven on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Fearn730
Reviews.Content: We were hoping for nice, but this was lovely in every way. We even got our own private balcony with chairs for 4. We could see the Grand Canal & St. Marks campinalle from it. The staff was very nice but by the end of August, they seemed exhausted! Be sure to ask for the Hot chocolate at breakfast, it was like a melted down candy bar! Breakfast was excellent & plentiful. Avoid the "free" taxi trip to Murano if you don't want a hard sell on buying glass. Room had lots of cable channels & Wifi in the room all worked!

Reviews.Title: “A must for Venice with one of the best views”
Reviews.Author: KSWRL
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed here for 3 nights and we couldn't fault it. We had the most fabulous room with a stunning view of the basin and the service we received from all the staff was excellent. It is ideally situated for all sights of Venice. A must is to dine in the small and intimate terrace restaurant and watch the sunset over Venice whilst enjoying divine food and service. If I ever have the fortune to return to Venice I would have no hesitation to stay here again. thank you so much for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but small room”
Reviews.Author: oliverAustralia
Reviews.Content: The location of the Locanda Vivaldi was excellent. The best thing about the hotel though, was the terrace looking towards the Grand Canal. The view from there was wonderful, especially at sunset. Our room, however, was very small and although it had all of the necessary amenities, it was not luxurious. I think that there are larger rooms and these are probably the ones featured on the website. However, all things being considered, it was a reasonable choice for an over crowded, over priced city.

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some Not so Good”
Reviews.Author: kbgdsg
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our recent trip to Venice. The location is amazing, the view from our room of the lagoon was amazing. The hotel is lovely, clean and well appointed. The automatic shade was excellent at keeping out the noise and light. We did encounter a few issues, one being the shower. It was getting hot, cold, hot, cold, etc. We spoke with the front desk and they were happy to try to fix it, switch rooms anything we wanted, they were very accomodating. Next, the A/C - it was awful! Having just come from Florence, our A/C there was terrific, here is was lousy. The first two of three nights we slept with the window open, it was cooler outside, than in - except, it was very humid. This defeated the point of the blackout shade in the morning. The last day they offered a fan to us, which was helpful, but we should have gotten it earlier. Apparently, the A/C there does not dehimidify the rooms so we were cooler, yet still sticky. Our main contact Simone was very helpful in trying to accomdate us any way he could, he was really trying - the night guy barely spoke English, was on the phone most of the time and did not really care about helping or doing much of anything else, other than talking on the phone. When we had a late night issue, he was so unhelpful, I actually went to the hotel next door for some assistance - they were very accomodating. The breakfast was very nice. The staff was mainly very nice and helpful. The free internet was great, but it was not great service, a lot of buffering. Overall a good not great value for the money because of these many issues. I am not sure if I would recommend it.....possibly, with qualifications.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: dcro2066
Reviews.Content: Our 2nd visit to the Vivaldi didn't disappoint. This time we stayed for a week in a superior room facing the Grand Canal and woke to a brilliant view 180degrees along the waterfront. We usually woke around 6am, and it was no trouble for Stephano, the night manager, to make us an eye-opening espresso. Breakfast from 7 30 wasmagnificent, being a full buffet which set us up for a full day of exploring Venice and it's islands. Recommend visiting Burano for it's colorful laid back atmosphere. Also recommend the operatic evening advertised in the hotel , which booked our tickets for us. Locanda Vivaldi is superbly located, staff are very friendly and helpful. We shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View and good service”
Reviews.Author: suchagirl
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was extremely satisfied with this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again. The bed and linens were comfortable. The service was good. Turn-down service was a nice touch. The breakfast was bountiful and included hot items. They will even make cappuchino for you. Above all, it was very clean. The only criticism that I had would be the wi-fi service was not very good - the issues related to the service provider not the hotel. The other criticism may be the fault of Expedia and not the hotel. Expedia stated that the hotel had laundry facilities, which to Americans means that there is a place in the hotel to do your own laundy. This hotel does not have that and neither did the other hotel I booked in Milan. This hotel will do your laundry for you for a charge. I believe there is something lacking in the communication between Expedia and their Italian hotels on this amenity.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value, great holiday”
Reviews.Author: gloriamundi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my husban's birthday during the carnival and had a great time. The location is fantastic, right on the St Marks basin, opposite the boat stop and a few minutes walk from St Mark's Square. The hotel staff were friendly and the food was good. This isn't the cheapest place to stay in Venice but is certainly my favourite and great value for money. We had a room with a lagoon view and what a view it was. The parades of people dressed up for carnival were passing by, we could see right accross the lagoon and along the front towards the entrance to the Grand Canal. The roof terrace has spectacular views! There was a bottle of champagne and a bowl of fruit in the room when we arrived, chocolates on the pillow and a card showing weather and flood forecast so you could be prepared to make the best of the city. The hotel has a private landing stage on the small canal at the side of the hotel and we treated ourselves to a water taxi to and from the airport - felt like movie stars and were treated as such by the hotel staff on arrival. The room was very comfortable and quiet - despite all the noise outside. Would definately use this hotel again when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: san1101
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view, perfect location. Very accomodating. The reservation included breakfast; where they served eggs and ham, pastries and meats. It also included a cappuccino, if you ordered it. Definitely have a drink on the rooftop. A free boat ride to Murano island. The staff were friendly. The hotel is very clean. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: clgarb111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Locanda Vivaldi for two nights and found it to be a very lovely hotel in a perfect location. The staff was very helpful and very professional. The rooms were very clean and always serviced at the appropriate time. Breakfast was very nice and the service there was great as well. I got to this hotel by accident due to a mix-up in another hotel reservation made but this ended up being a really good accident. Be sure and visit the rooftop bar and relax with a beautiful view of the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Superb experience in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donnysoupdragon
Reviews.Content: Booked a superior double room for wife`s birthday through expedia. Hotel in a great location, only yards away from Waterbus stop and very close to St. Marks Square. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was brilliant, large and well appointed, plenty of complimenties in the bathroom, wife especially appreciated the slippers after a hard days window shopping. Nice touches like leaving the following days weather forecast on the pillows gives the hotel a very friendly feel. Breakfast provided a wide range of choices to suit all tastes, although sweet pastries were a bit strange to the English palate ( I tried the lot!) Very tasty. Would recommend this hotel to friends & family we enjoyed it that much.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: susielou36
Reviews.Content: Lovely small, typical, Italian hotel near St Marks piazza. Good service, friendly staff, nice quiet room. Within easy walking distance of the piazza and water bus stops. Worked well for us. The only downside was the cafe underneath the hotel, which I think was separate - we paid 38Euro for two Sprites and two ice creams!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: IanF073
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, lovely room, beautiful location The roof terrace must have one of the best views in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, service average and A/C terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Markperthmarkperth
Reviews.Content: We paid quite a bit of money for this hotel. The rooms were very nice, and had all that we needed. The beds were comforatable. The location was unbeatable, however in typical venetian style the person who checked us in was pompus. However he spoke good english, which could perhaps compensate for the attitude. Overall, the place was very nice, view wa amazing!!, and clean, however the service of one person ruined the efforts of most. Tomasso (think thats how it is spelt) was very helpful and a very nice person. I would recommend it if you are a slightly older couple, but if you are a younger couple looking for somewhere, look somewhere else, as i got the impression they were not happy to have younger people staying there. Even though we were in bed early almost every night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel, handy spot, amazing view.”
Reviews.Author: Nbonoz
Reviews.Content: Such a lovely gem of a hotel. The service was great, always attentive and very obliging. We were pleasantly surprised on our arrival to have such a huge room with a terrace the length of our room looking directly out over the canal (red junior suite). We could sit and watch all the people bustling around 4 floors below. The room was very spacious and easily accommodated a family of 4. The shutters blocked out 100% natural light which was very handy as we arrived very jet lagged from Australia and managed to sleep well each night without waking when the sun came up very early. Drinks on the terrace in the evening was so beautiful. We will definitely stay here again if we get the chance to return.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, intimate and something special”
Reviews.Author: dolcevita-italia
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel with a group of girlfriends to accompany our daughters on a school choir trip to Venice. From booking through to departure, the staff were helpful and friendly. When another friend (staying at a different hotel) wanted to join forces with us, they happily arranged for another bed to be put in one of the rooms. Fab location, just a stone's throw from St Mark's. Lovely roof terrace not used much by us as unfortunately the weather was rather unforgiving despite the fact that it was June. Would I return ~ most definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hope1215
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. First, it's in a very convenient location, literally just steps away from one of the main public water taxi options.. The location also was very upscale but not excessively pricey either. Rooms were immaculate and kept very well maintained, including evening service. Management was extremely helpful and very interested in helping us in any way. We had three rooms and all were very nicely appointed, including free internet service. We had great breakfasts with many options included in room pricing. Restaurant overlooking entire area was just lovely. I would highly recommend this hotel and if ever back in Venice would definitely return. In summary combination of great location, excellent service and very clean hotel made this a real winner.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best”
Reviews.Author: Piotr60
Reviews.Content: It was our fourth visit to the hotel and although we were offered other places, we find nothing really comparable. Main and important to us features are: excellent location, minutes walk from most of Venice attractions, meters from water transport stops. Great interior and spacious, very well maintained rooms, most with uncomparable view to the Laguna and Canale Grande entrance. And most of all professional, friendly, always helpful staff, who patiently guided us through Venice and Veneto. For all those four years we visited Venice we were never disapointed with their advice. They know the place by heart and they always help. 2011 additions: next door concerts and, following new national regulations in Italy, Internet access through all hotel, free.

Reviews.Title: “Central Lagoon view traditional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christina075
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Vivaldi which had been recommended by friends. The roof terrace has amazing views across Venice. Rooms very traditional and breakfast good. Staff are helpful although not over friendly. My room had a lagoon view (lovely) but was on first floor which made it a bit noisy given this hotel is on main tourist thoroughfare along the water right by St Marks. Great location for the river boat buses and very close to the airoprt taxi river boat stop which makes a short break very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dinia6
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location looking across the lagoon to San Giorgio. Although the waterfront is busy, it quietens down at night. Bedroom very comfortable with nice bathroom. Staff could not have been more helpful. Plenty of restaurants within 5/10 minutes walk plus small rooftop restaurant in the hotel with nice food and possibly the best view in Venice. Second visit and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: GiovannaUsa
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and the hotel has old world charm. We especially enjoyed the stunning view from the restaurant where we had drinks and a delicious dinner both nights with the grandchildren. The hotel is very well located near St. Marks and the water with all the boats. Breakfast was excellent. We plan to return to this small hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Excellent Location, shame about details”
Reviews.Author: ChristinafromCyprus
Reviews.Content: 5 of us stayed there for a Birthday celebration. Incidentally it was Carnival time. Couldn't ask for better location. Whole parade passed under our window. The rooms are comfortable and clean. Very comfortable bathroom but the jaccuzzi bathtub was damaged and it uncomfortable standing in it. Most of the concierge/ reception are very polite. Pity about the breakfast which is cooked by the waiter and the waitress who also doubled as porter and housekeeper. Imagine the result in particular during a very busy Carnival weekend. Badly laid tables, no crockery or cutlery available, hardly any food on the buffet left way before the end of breakfast time. When fianlly our fried eggs arrived way overcooked the waiter said ' little overcooked but never mind'!!!! and he was annoyed that I resorted to the Receptionist to get a decent breakfast.Definetely not their fault though but taht of the management who did not employ more staff to help out

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Marion4444
Reviews.Content: Venice ist a very special and wonderful place and Locando Vivaldi is a wonderful hotel! We stayed the second time in Venice and in the hotel and enjoyed it very very much. Our room was very comfortable and beautiful. We like the Venetian decoration and the spectacular views to the lagune of Venice. If you walk during the day through the narrow streets and through the special world of little canals and bridges it is wonderful to have in the mornings and evenings the atmosphere and the lights of the lagoon (sunrise and sunset). You see all kinds of boats and you have an amazing view to San Giorgio and Santa Maria della Salute. The service of the hotel is excellent and the staff is very friendly, helpful and always in good mood. The hotel is centrally located next to piazza san marco and next to a vaporetto station but you can also easily walk to all places. We can highly recommend this hotel. Grazie mille a tutto il personale!!

Reviews.Title: “Quite, comfortable and probably the best location.”
Reviews.Author: Vladimir P
Reviews.Content: Pros. Small and very quiet. Helpful and friendly staff. Clean and welcoming attitude. Nice but slightly poor breakfast. Very well located near all that You need in Venice. The Suite has a balcony with a great view to the lagoon but the suite itself is not that big as You expect for that price. Cons. Slightly overpriced. Not enough services for an european 4*. No restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: brumari
Reviews.Content: the people of the hotel were not so nice and i found still trash from someone that was in the room before us. But it is well located , the room is proper and the breakfast is good, , indeed the hot chocolate is not what we expect from a hot chocolate in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “A rare hospitality”
Reviews.Author: floreal
Reviews.Content: On a short stay in magic and cold Venice, we found Locanda Vivaldi warm and cosy, extremely comfortable and hospitable. Large and tastefully decorated room, agreeable and efficient helpdesk, perfect but discrete service, generous breakfast. Excellent situation, lively very early in the morning, but quiet at night. We appreciated free-WiFi, although we found its access a bit clumsy. We recommend heartily Locanda Vivaldi, from its staff to its manager! Arrivederci!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Milutin57
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the almost perfect place, in front of all important vaporeto stations at San Marco square. The service at the reception is excellent. Breakfast is sufficient. Rooms are very clean. The Hotel is located at the canal with one side, and laudness of motorboats is sometimes a problem, over night. The only thing that realy is a problem is the absence of kitchen and room service beside breakfast. Although in Venice, sometimes you don't want to go out, and then there is nothing you can it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice For Parents Traveling with Kids; Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: Ravens32
Reviews.Content: If you stay at this hotel, get a room with a view of the Lagoon. The view is amazing and really adds to the pleasure of staying in Venice. The rooms are small but adequate and nicely appointed. Also had a triple room for my kids that was split into two small bedrooms with a common bath (one double bed and one single bed). For families that need multiple rooms, this hotel is a good choice (the triple room for the kids is across the hall from the room overlooking the lagoon). Excellent location next to Valperetto station (if you sleep with your window open you will hear boats all night) and 2 minute walk to St. Marks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: nayanie
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and I definitely chose a great hotel with a fantastic location. The water taxi stop was a minute away from the hotel entrance and all the main tourist spots such as St Mark basilica was ariund 5 mins walk for us. We walked everywhere and found the whole Venice experience very exciting. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and even laid on a bottle of wine for my fiance birthday. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small and friendly hotel -great position and value”
Reviews.Author: Thorndon_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel position over-looking Grand Canal was a real treat. It is very convenient for the major Venice sights and water buses. The staff were very helpful and friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay. We will certainly hope to stay again on any future visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: bettypalmer
Reviews.Content: Water taxi to the door - porter to greet and assist - friendly manager - lovely furnishings throughout. Bathroom all one could wish, only complaint bedroom quite dark and lighting poor which made it impossible to read. However beds extremely comfortable. Breadkfast in very nice little dining room was excellent. Dining room on upstaris terrace lacked atmosphere but I expect it would be lovely in summer. Altogether a very good choice as so well positioned and good value.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location In Venice”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGal62
Reviews.Content: My sister and I traveled with my Dad here in late October and found this to be a great hotel. It has a wonderful location right on the water, the breakfast was very good, the rooms were beautiful with wonderful views, and the staff couldn't be more accommodating. While the showers were a bit tight (but nearly all hotels have small showers) the room was well furnished with velvet covered hangers and an in-room safe and the windows opened so you could get some fresh air. We had to leave early our final morning at 4:30 a.m. and they arranged for our water taxi, carried out our bags, and even got us a quickie breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and superb view”
Reviews.Author: phguyot
Reviews.Content: We booked the junior suite with lagoon view and we were not disappointed. The room was large with a nice balcony. Decoration was old fashioned but the room was well isolated from external noise and the bed very comfortable. Bathroom was average : a bit small and below a 4stars standard. Location is perfect : next to the Danielli at half price....Staff very helpful and pleasant. They offer a taxi boat to Murano driving you to a nice glass factory (you should negociate the prices...). Breakfast was fine , nothing flashy but good. In my mind, this hotel is a great compromise if you look for comfort, location and view at an "affordable" price.

Reviews.Title: “The Good,The Bad,The Ulgy”
Reviews.Author: CaliGirl007_10
Reviews.Content: OK..Hope this Gives you a "Better' feel for this hotel than I had read about..First the GOOD..Great Location..Very clean..Free Wifi..Free Roof top Proscecco..Oh and the Roof Top is A Killer View !!!!! Now the BAD..No Air Cond. In Oct..And it was Hot w/Humidity..The Older Woman Looked @ me like I was From another Planet when I asked about Air Con..?? She said "No" it as turned off It is "bad" for you.? Well just because Venetian's think it it cool out does'nt mean other people who pay $$$$$ for this hotel think it is acceptable ( I am from California) Now the Shower..It is as small as a shower in a "Motor Home" And you certainly can't drop the soap !! My husband is 6'1 and a NAVY Diver..Way too small!!! Oh back to the AC,,We kept the window open & mosquito's bites eveywhere..Now the ULGY..The Front Desk Woman>> Not very nice..Look's like she hates her Job.Very Miserable..Which put a Damper on my First Visit ti Italy for my 20th Anniversary. Hope this helps you all :) Teri So Cal. USA

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but with a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: pdxbrophym
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Locanda Vivaldi was really a mix of highs and lows. The location is centerally located to all the major sites. The room is very well appointed. We had our teenage daughter with us and it was our fault not to have requested a larger room. The room size is on the smaller size, even by European standards. The breakfast buffet was delicous with many different selections to choose from. The staff was professional, but a bit on the "cooler" side. We spent a month traveling through Europe and had a wonderful experience with 90% of the hotel staff being excellent. Locanda Vivaldi staff was not in the excellent category. We did have quite a bit of noise because we were on the lagoon side. This is a positive and a negative...the positive being the beautiful view from our window, the noise through out the day and into the night falls on the negative side. I would not rule this hotel out for our next stay in Venice, but I would look for other options too.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: melbur
Reviews.Content: we stayed again this year at the Locanda Vivaldi after our Med cruise. We stayed there last year and had a superb time so booked it again. It doesn't disappoint - in a fabulous location right on the Grand Canal basin, minutes away from St Marks. The rooftop terrace is a wonderful spot to sit and watch the busy waterways and people. Service was excellent. The breakfast room has a variety of items to suit everyone. We will be going back again next year!!

Reviews.Title: “What more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: gnadivi
Reviews.Content: Why isn't this hotel ranked higher? We stayed there for 3 nights at the end of August 2010 and the accommodations, location, customer service, and breakfast were all excellent. It really should be a Top 10 hotel in Venice. My one complaint was their WiFi connectivity was free, but abysmally slow. I will post pictures of the small shower in some of the rooms that people are referring to. Be sure to let them know if you're over 6 feet tall, as this may be an issue for you.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Evisco
Reviews.Content: Room 302 at the Locanda Vivaldi is THE place to stay in Venice. Warm welcome,complimentary chilled sparkling wine ready in the room and fantastic views from the terrace of so many of the wonderful places. Very comfortable bed and room and excellent breakfast to start the day. Would recommend to any one. Staff went out of their way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views/good service”
Reviews.Author: Gomyone
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at this hotel. The location is very good and is conveniently situated by a major waterbus stop - very important when you are in Venice because porters are expensive and if you are located somewhere within the city itself - its pretty difficult to navigate thru crowds and bridges with luggage in hand. All in all, we found the service at this hotel to be very good, warm and inviting. The rooftop patio (where drinks and dinner are served) was excellent and had splendid views of Venice). Note that unlike some of the other hotels that we stayed at in Italy, breakfast is not served on the rooftop but in the "breakfast room" downstairs. Not a big deal as the room itself is nicely appointed with a good selection of hot and cold food in the buffet (this was one of the rare hotels in Italy that actually served "toast"!) As for the rooms, we booked a standard "double" through Expedia. I found it fairly pricey considering how tiny the room actually is. And unlike most other hotels we stayed at in Italy, a "double" here does not have a king bed but actually has a double which is even smaller than a queen. The bathroom had only a small standup shower that was quite "tight" and I'm only 5'9 and of average build. Someone who was taller or bigger than me would truly have a tough time in there! Nevertheless, considering that all of Venice tends to be somewhat pricy and crampt (part of its charm really), it wasn't that big a deal. All in all, a nicely located, well appointed hotel with pretty good service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at excellent location”
Reviews.Author: avipiti
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the mini-suite facing the grand canal. The room was very large and beautiful, and the views of the canal are amazing. Breakfast is very good. We arrived from the airport by water-taxi, which is the only way to directly reach the hotel without having to climb over at least one bridge (a lot of steps). The hotel is a few minutes walk from almost all major attractions. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There are many good restaurants right next to the hotel. The jetted bath was large and clean. A few minor problems: 1. The mini-suite is on the 3rd floor, right next to the night restaurant, so sometimes guests make some noise 2. The water pressure is quite low, so it takes a long time to fill-up the bath

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: redsbench5
Reviews.Content: Our room overlooked the canal which was a constant source of entertainment. Room was decent size with high ceilings. Shower was a little tight, if you are over 6 foot or a wide body you may not fit at least in our shower, maybe other rooms have different set ups . A little surprised that the tv was not a flat screen although there is not much to watch anyway. Breakfast was a nice spread and the restaurant was cute and had a nice view. Even if your not eating there probably a nice place to sit and have a drink. Personnel were nice except for one woman at the front desk who made us feel that we were bothering her whenever we asked for something. No smile no pleasantries.Oh well. Would stay here again though. Easy walk to San Marco Square

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY.”
Reviews.Author: mikolor
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Locanda Vivaldi. We arrived after a long international flight to our lovely, quiet rooms which looked out over San Mark's basin. We slept wonderfully and were able to recover from jet lag in our very comfortable rooms with very nice bathrooms, and a nice view of the lagoon. The staff was excellent, very helpful. We suggest every one this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in an Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mndoc
Reviews.Content: We arrived jet lagged, luggage free and tired. Check in was effortless, personal care items were offered, condolences expressed and directions provided. Room was clean and quiet with a view of the rear courtyard/garden. Breakfast was wonderful and allowed us to explore until well into the afternoon before a reload was needed. When we asked about a trip to the glass works at murano they arranged a water taxi to pick us up at the hotel dock and bring us over free of charge (yes, we did end up buying something at the glass shop - i guess the ride served it purpose!) that boat ride was one of the highlights of my trip! No complaints - a perfect stay. Would gladly come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, very accomodating staff.”
Reviews.Author: HankmanTokyo
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late at night and the staff were expecting us. The staff were very helpful, pointing out locations on the map, offering suggestions, Stephano and Titti were both spot on with suggestions. We loved the breakfast nook. Very cute and just the right mix of fruit, breads, and standard fare. If your room (like our's) is facing the sea-front it can get a little noisy with people walking by however Venice goes to sleep fairly early so unless you're going to bed at 8, don't worry about it. The view definately outweighted any "noise". In the end, the staff really made our stay enjoyable. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you can.”
Reviews.Author: bcnsontca
Reviews.Content: Our favorite hotel of three on our recent trip to Italy. Beautiful, historic, spotless, wonderful location, an expert concierge. The bedrooms were a little baroque in their color selection but the beds were perfect, sheets crisp, windows open wide, the bathroom was spacious and beautiful, with good hot water pressure. Rooftop garden on the grand canal, three bridges from the Piazza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “View of Grand Canal from Room 302/dining room is superb, but breakfast is sad.”
Reviews.Author: ridiculousLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Venice. We decided to splurge and stay at this hotel for our second visit too. Staff is efficient, although a little aloof. Housekeeping had trouble on our second day and did not make up the room until after 4 pm. However, you cannot beat the location as it is next door to Santa Maria della Pieta, one bridge down from the S. Zacharaia vaparetto stop/Aliluguna airport shuttle stop-- and just a few minutes walk from St. Mark's square. In spite of the fact that this hotel is top-notch (decor is "very Vivaldi" with tons of Murano glass fixtures, mirrors, etc. and the linens are immaculate), the breakfast selection is just plain disapointing and under par for such a high-end hotel. The "srambled eggs" were disgusting. Also, because the location is so close to St. MArk's, there is an incredible amount of hustle-bustle in front of the hotel. Thousands of people passing by and hyndreds of boats coming ang going all the time. Be prepared for huge crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect balance of what one could look for in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Piotr60
Reviews.Content: Location: close to all main tourist attractions in Venice, few minutes to St Marco Square, overlooks one of main walking paths - Riva Degli Schiavoni. Also close to water transport stops - makes travel around Venice and lagoon (Murano, Burano, Lido and others) easy. Good public water transport from railway station and airport for those who want to save on water taxi. Hotel's own water taxi and gondola stop. Rooms: nice, cozy, quite big as for European city, very clean and well maintained. Also suites, last year we booked one with private balcony. This year we booked double overlooking St Marco basin. Large terrace on the top floor, excellent to watch the basin, Island of S.Giorgio Maggiore, very busy water path, sometimes with big ships, and entrance to the Great Canal. Services: solid breakfast with good choice of food. Own restaurant open at the evening. Bar - serves also appetizers before restaurant is open. No concierge but the front desk staff great and friendly, they are always ready to give you advice and help to set things. We followed their recommendations several times and we were never disappointed. Staff really makes a difference here. General: small hotel which gives you all you need plus family feeling and individual treatment. Instead of recommendation I can only say that this was our third stay at Locanda Vivaldi and we intend to be beck next year to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful period hotel”
Reviews.Author: KIRSMOM
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for modern, this isn't it. If you're looking for atmosphere and history, you couldn't do better for the price. We were charmed by the staff, thought the breakfast more than ample with many choices, our suite was very comfortable for the 3 of us, and incredibly quiet. Staff went out of their way to make reservations, map out directions, etc. Internet (free) worked perfectly in our rooms. Location ideal, facing the Grand Canal and a short distance from Plaza San Marco. We'll be back and thank you again so much for all you did to make our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Location, views and service would bring us back to Locanda Vivaldi”
Reviews.Author: camplund
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful. Vaporetti stops are within 100 meters, the transport from the airport lands very near and your two bridges from St. Mark's and the Doge's Palace. The staff were very helpful, the room was clean and quiet and we overlooked a canal. We hope to return in a couple of years since two nights aren't nearly enough!

Reviews.Title: “A unique and very comfortable way of discovering Venice”
Reviews.Author: HarryWassenaar
Reviews.Content: The location is very central and convenient to be reached. The hotel is stylish decorated and makes you feel at home. The hotel staff is extremely helpful and customer focussed. Pleasant rooms, lots of space and with a nice atmosphere. We will be back next time when we visit Venice!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again if I was lucky enough to return to Venice.”
Reviews.Author: prettyauntnancy
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect. The room was much bigger than I expected. I was not expecting robes and slippers for what I paid. The breakfast was much better than expected. Delicious butter. The room was so quiet I had to open the window to hear the sounds of the city, the bells and the boats. We felt like we were the only people there, except at breakfast. Turn-down service, cleanliness, friendly staff, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: tu-quoque
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Locanda Vivaldi for 3 days and had a wonderful time. We found it through Trip Advisor, which is how we found every hotel on our trips. The hotel is less than three minutes walk along the waterfront to San Marco Square, fantastic location. The entrance to the hotel is welcoming and the reception area pleasant, relaxing and with a discrete elegance. There's an excellent choice of international papers to read and the staff are all extremely helpful and friendly .We did pay for a lagoon-view room, and our room (205) opened right onto the Riva degli Schiavoni, the main waterfront walk. The view was amazing. The room is charmingly decorated in a tasteful baroque style and the bathroom is newly renovated in white marble and very clean (included jacuzzi style baths). The breakfast was excellent- plenty of choice, and always eggs plus the usual continental fare. . Excellent pastries. Wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel. Our desire is to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliantly located, good breakfast, wonderful view, excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: bumble3
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit and was every bit as good as our first. Staff are very helpful (duff electrical socket in the bathroom completely replaced within hours and extension lead supplied in the meantime). Cleaning/housekeeping standards are high, service at breakfast friendly and swift (probably the best coffee we had in Venice...yes, including Florian's!!) reception staff always ready to help (checking information at the airport for us in view of BA strike, looking after luggage after we had checked out, good advice on where to eat). The room (Superior double with view across to San Giorgio M.) was not noisy, as some have suggested, was comfortable and well-appointed and was scrupulously clean. This hotel is excellently located in itself and superbly situated for transport (If you use the Alilaguna service from the airport it stops just outside. If you come in from the airport by bus to Piazzale Roma, then the line 1 or 2 vaporetti will drop you off close by: San Zaccaria is the stop you want)

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: modemUk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at the Locanda Vivaldi and must say I do not recognise the hotel as described in the previous review. The staff were professional and courteous and our room, a lagoon view double, was clean and comfortable. We heard hardly any noise from other guests and were surprised when we went down to breakfast to see how many people were in fact staying at the hotel. We found the location very convenient for both walking to most places and using the vaporetti as well as the Alilaguna ferry from the airport. The breakfast buffet was excellent with fresh brown and white rolls, sliced bread for toasting, fresh fruit salad, cereals, scrambled eggs, bacon, cold meats, cheeses, fruit juices and a selection of cake and pastries. It was replenished regularly. The only slight problem we had is outwith the hotel's control ie on Friday and Saturday there was some outside noise from passing groups of teenagers enjoying their night out. However, given the location, it is not surprising that there is some noise from passers by but by midnight all was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, unaccommodating, mismanaged â€“ avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: W1Adam
Reviews.Content: I am a contributor to several travel publications and stay regularly in Venice. I had the misfortune of spending a long weekend organised by relatives of mine at the Locanda Vivaldi â€“ never again. The hotel is tired and grotty â€“ the grim dÃ©cor and dim lighting could only appeal to someone who hadnâ€™t been abroad in 30 years. The bathrooms date from decades passed, the beds are only big enough if you to sleep on your side. The breakfast is akin to an economy class flight â€“ a bunch of bland supermarket products, greasy croissants, no fresh bread, no fruit salad and so on. But I would have happily overlooked all of this â€“ this is after all a very popular destination â€“ were it not for the experience I had in reception on arrival with Stefano, the day manager, when my brother and I were presented with a double (rather than twin) room that stunk of cigarette smoke. Rather than apologising for any misunderstanding, Stefano smirked as I got gradually more irritated â€“ â€œthis is the room we haveâ€�, he repeated incessantly, although the more proactive bellhop shortly found us another one. He disingenuously tried to blame a relative of mine for misunderstanding on making the booking. Speaking at the same time as me and constantly interrupting, he was happy for the conversation to descend into a screaming match â€“ despite the fact that two elderly relatives of mine, who were also staying in the hotel for our celebration, were with me at the time. Stefano doesnâ€™t give out business cards â€“ he refused to even write his name down when I asked for it â€“ perhaps because he is ashamed of his own behaviour. Not that it matters â€“ book into this hotel and youâ€™ll realise within 30 seconds of arriving which one he is â€“ never in my extensive travel experience have I encountered an attitude problem of this magnitude. I look forward to a predictable response by Roberto Dazzo in his trademark broken English as he tries once again to defend his inexplicable decision to retain this incompetent over so many years â€“ their relationship eludes me. Needless to say, we tried several times to reach him during our stay â€“ he categorically ignored our calls and messages, despite finding the time to talk extensively with Stefano about our dispute. Readers be warned â€“ Dazzo and his staff are known in the local community for their complacence and ineptitude. Venice already struggles hard enough economically and cannot afford to see this vital industryâ€™s reputation undermined by charlatans with a blatant disregard for professionalism and basic integrity â€“ all those who love this city have a duty to avoid this hotel at all costs, and to warn others to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect place to stay in venice”
Reviews.Author: essexladyRomford
Reviews.Content: our room looked out onto the lagoon and it was the most fantastic view. The room itself was spotless and the bathroom big and airy, with fluffly dressing gowns and plenty of towels!!! Breakfast was plentiful and varied with cereals hot bacon eggs and cold meats. Venice was just as I had dreamed it would be and locanda vivaldi was the hidden gem!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful carnival stay!”
Reviews.Author: travelkd
Reviews.Content: Being 2nd time in Venice for the carnival, we chose once again "Locanda Vivaldi" hotel for the excellent location and staff hospitality. The hotel is ideally located minutes from all attractions with beautiful views of the Venetian lagoon and the St Giorgio island. Rooms are open and airy with traditional venetian furniture and murano lights. When sunny, you can enjoy magnificent views and a beautiful sunset over Santa Maria de la Salute! Staff extremely polite and helpful, making you feel as a very wellcome guest. Breakfast is served in a cozy room by the side canal and the selection is great. Overall, a beautiful hotel in Venice, worth visiting and revisiting...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, great spot to stay”
Reviews.Author: wombatsrevenge
Reviews.Content: The location promises a lot, and barely disappoints. We arrived by water taxi from the airport (5 minute walk from the arrivals gate, and a much shorter (and more convenient) trip than all the alternatives - albeit pricey (we bought our inbound ticket in the airport concourse, 105 euros; the bloke on the way back charged us 120 - the great italian scam in action). It was so romantic to arrive by side canal and dismbark onto the hotel's private jetty. The only surprise was to find a carabineri station on the other side of the canal! We shared a connected room with our three kids (11 to 16) and all fitted in fine. Breakfast was fine, and the service (from a bloke who doubled as the hotel's porter during the rest of the day) kind and attentive. My brother in law found the third floor terrace (overlooking Riva Schiavoni) a fantastic place to polish off (over 3 nights) the bottle of 18 year old Japanese duty free whisky he had bought in the Gatwick duty free shop (why??!). Venice is everything we could have expected and more. Just walk and walk ... then when you need to get back to the hotel, find a water bus. And yes, we did take a gondola ride - the highlight of our kids' stay in Venice, and worth it despite the price. Watch the hotel's internet deal - they sell time on the computer in half hour blocks, which you have to use in one go. Also watch the heating in the rooms - we fought with the control box for half an hour before giving up and asking for help from the guy on the front desk who, it turns our, tontrols everything centrally anyway (or so he said, but he couldn't fix the fug either so eventually we agreed he should turn it off altogether).

Reviews.Title: “romantic hotel in good location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: psri
Reviews.Content: we stayed for new year. Good service generally and comfortable rooms although a little small and decor a bit tired in places. Slightly chaotic at breakfast as the breakfast room was a bit small for all of the guests. We would rate it a three star although the location probably pulls it up. We had a lagoon view but it was quite noisy from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect hotel - perfect location - couldn't have asked for better!”
Reviews.Author: bluebell28
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a surprise break for our family, to celebrate our eldest son's 21st birthday (he has always wanted to visit Venice!) We were NOT disappointed in any way at all. The hotel was in an ideal location, overlooking the lagoon and just 5 minutes walk from St Marks Square. Don't be put off by the plain exterior - the rooms are beautifully furnished with every attention to detail (including complimentary slippers, etc). The staff were helpful and spoke English, and there was 24-hour reception service. The breakfasts were plentiful and, as you serve yourself, you could choose exactly what you liked. A fantastic stay - we all loved it and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel in a wonderful setting”
Reviews.Author: loops79blue
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here on our honeymoon. We had an amazing trip to Italy and stayed in 2 other hotels, one in Amalfi and one in Rome. Unfortunately this was not our favourite out of the three, but i would say that's not because the hotel was bad, it was our first experience of a boutique hotel, and something we were just not used to. Good points: interesting Fabric padded walls, great location, a fabulous view; our room looked directly on to the police station which kept me amused for hours, and to the left the view was of the grand canal, totally amazing. There were thick comfy robes and Vivaldi slippers in the bathroom, which is a nice touch. On our last night the bed was turned down when we were out and sweets were left on the pillow, which was a wonderful touch. The breakfast was excellent and the personal, friendly efficient service was provided each day from the reception staff. The roof top restaurant is also a must see, highly recommended I would recommend this hotel, but don't expect a modern 4 star hotel with loads of space and mod cons, but expect a more unique hotel with personal service you wouldn't get from a large chain of hotels

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not a four star!!!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotters13
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed here for a new year break. Our room was clean but small with a very small and uncomfortable bed, also the shower was only just big enough to get into, if you dropped something you had to get out to pick it up.Our room was on the first floor and the noise of the boats could be heard very loudly. We were disappointed with the breakfast which is served 7.30 -10.30, but at 9.00 had very little left and we werent always asked if we would like a hot drink so went without on one occasion. The staff were friendly but i would not return to this hotel or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “a dream: venezia under sun, snow and acqua alta”
Reviews.Author: luciaparis
Reviews.Content: the hotel has a wonderful location; easy to reach with the boat from the airport; the room with a view on the laguna is charming with view on the sun rise and sunset and a view on the everyday life of the laguna. It is however surprising that a hotel with such a standing does not have wifi connections!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of rain but a great hotel and stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TangoDuo
Reviews.Content: An excellent location coupled with a great staff made this a wonderful place to stay. The room was very roomy and comfortable and accessible by elevator. The staff were very helpful with recommendations on sight seeing, restaurants, and places to shop. The hotel's location made getting around quite easy and the view from our window was well worth the extra cost for this location. The hotel has a bar on both the lower level and the roof. Internet service was available only on a lobby computer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the most perfect setting.”
Reviews.Author: Veneziani
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at Locanda Vivaldi was even more perfect than the time before. The location is just right for sight-seeing, dining, shopping and relaxation. The room we chose was superb, with views across to San Giorgio Maggiore and to La Salute. We cannot fault the staff at all, they are so accommodating, friendly and helpful. Our next visit can not come soon enough.From this and previous visits we now have quite a list of favourites ie. restaurants, shops and sights to visit and will never be able to see and enjoy enough.Our desire is to return again and again. Locanda Vivaldi - grazie a lei ! Il piacere e tuto mio !!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: prouditalian55
Reviews.Content: I bought this honeymoon trip for my son and his wife. They had a corner room overlooking the lagoon and a canal. They walked 5 minutes from Marco Polo airport to the water taxi which took them to the front steps of the hotel. Orbitz faxed a request for a double bed for the honeymooners and the Locanda obliged. Whenver I have the chance to visit Venice again I will stay at the Locanda Vivaldi. The honeymooners did not have a single complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: melbur
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple stayed here one night pre cruise beginning of October. The hotel was lovely, with a perfect location on the canal basin, walking a couple of minutes to St Marks. We had the "red room" and it was large, lovely, well appointed with a great view of the canal. Our friends were in Rm 206, a great corner room with super views as well. Service was excellent. Breakfast in their dining area was good with lots offered. The upstairs terrace was still open, so we enjoyed cocktails and snacks there, complete with the beautiful scenery. We are back in Venice again next September and will definetely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty inside and great value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: phdtravel
Reviews.Content: Very good value for a Venice hotel with water views. Charming and comfortable room and modern but small bathroom. Cute sitting area lobby. Convenient short walk to Piazza San Marco. Most recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Locanda Vivaldi”
Reviews.Author: csuttonCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in October. Our room (302) was beautiful, with a large terrace overlooking San Marco Basin. The service was excellent and the staff couldn't have been nicer. In addition to all above, the breakfast was very nice. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Thank you to all the staff who made our stay a very enjoyable one. C. Sutton

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: dgrant11
Reviews.Content: Locanda Vivaldi is beautiful, elegant, and in perfect location - on the Grand Canal 2 bridges from Piazza San Marco. The water taxi took us directly to the hotel side entrance and the hotel provided free water taxi to Murano. Our room was very large by Venice standards and spotless. The breakfast buffet was delicious and abundant.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room - Big Price”
Reviews.Author: foodiesouthflorida
Reviews.Content: We booked a Double Superior corner room on the first floor (Italian first floor is second US). When we arrived we saw we were staring at the throngs of people on the elevated pedestrian bridge outside of the window, which the hotel did not disclose to us. My wife was irate that she would be staring at thousands of people. The hotel moved us to a very small room on the floor above. The room was the size of our master bathroom at home. We paid 420 Euros, which is $621 per night at today's exchange rate. I asked if the rate would be lower because this was a smaller room, but was told it was in the same category becuase this is a "16th Century Villa and all the rooms are different". The bottom line is if you want to stay in Venice be prepared to pay double most other major cities in the world for smaller rooms or do not expect to have a view of anything. Either you pay $1,000 per night or more for a room with a view in a luxury hotel or you downgrade to a two or three star hotel with no view if you are on a budget. The hotel includes breakfast but most flights to the US leave early in the morning, so you will not be able to use the breakfast when you leave. Also, most flights from the US arrive early in the morning but you will not be able to check in until 2 p.m. at the earliest.
