In a larger hotel, with a larger staff, you can usually check in earlier, but this is a small hotel with a very small staff.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant but not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: janfromtoledo
Reviews.Content: Reserved a double room. It was the smallest room I've ever stayed in, not large enough for two people! The shower was the size found in a motor home. I seriously doubt a large man would have fit. The hotel was close to St. Mark's Square but wished we had stayed somewhere closer to restaurants, bars and shops. Breakfast was included and decent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderful views, comfortable atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: NJcruiserEB
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel- it was like a little jewel in the glittering crown of Venice! We felt very pampered even before our arrival, as we stopped in a day early. The concierge and bellman were extremely helpful. The breakfast was included and perfect for our large group of eight (two families with children ranging from 10-22). Loved relaxing in the lobby and the gelateria next door! The price was very good for a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel in Over-priced Venice...”
Reviews.Author: kobekeith
Reviews.Content: Venice itself is kind of a rip-off & it took me a second trip there to figure it out but this hotel was better than the other 2 hotels that I had stayed in before. It is actually a 4-star quality hotel as opposed to the other one I tried the last time. This was my second hotel on this trip after one night in an ant-infested hotel on the Grand Canal. I stayed in the Vivaldi for 6 nights and did not encounter any major problems. The shower was tiny and I cannot imagine how big people can use it but it was always spotless so I didn't mind bumping my arms on clean walls now and again. I did report that the water went hot and cold over and over again during showers and it was never fixed but it was summer so the cold water did not bother me too much. I heard guests from 101 and 102 had the same problems. Air conditioning was my #1 priority and my room was good. Other guests at breakfast told me that they had hot rooms which would have killed me but room 110 was good and cool. A family with 2 rooms had to change from one of their rooms during their stay because of the a/c. The hot room for them was 104. (I took notes at the time.) About the rooftop terrace, great place for a drink and to enjoy the view. I have no idea how a previous reviewer could have stayed in the Vivaldi and NOT known that it was up there as there were signs in a few places directing people to it and the desk staff mentioned it twice and then the guy who helped me to my room, showed me the terrace as well. (There is NO WAY that they freshly squeezed the orange juice that I was served up there though!) I do agree with the same reviewer that they over-charge for the internet. The manager response to that review was typical. It is NOT normal in the hotel world to fleece your guests for internet use but it is normal in Venice to fleece all 10 million visitors as much as possible during their time there. It's almost 8 dollars (U.S) an hour for guests to use the internet in the lobby. It wasn't exactly worth the mosquito bites I got while sitting there. That rate is "normal" for internet cafes in the city. Hotels should offer it for free to paying guests otherwise it is just another internet cafe. I found that 2 out of 3 men at the concierge desk were very helpful. Claudio and Danielle were the 2 nice ones. The other man worked days and he was pretty indifferent, not very helpful and not easily approachable. He completely misdirected me for a day-trip to Chioggia and I am 100% sure that he did so because he could not be bothered at that time to help me. He was always busy with something on the computer and only gave quick answers. Claudio gave me detailed directions to Chioggia later on that same day and it entailed 3 modes of transport as opposed to the one way that the other man told me. He is also pretty typical of service in Venice so I was not too bothered by his attitude and approach to poor customer service. (We owe them for their service and should just be happy to be in Venice.) I just wanted a clean place with air conditioning near everything so my expectations were met. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very unhelpful concierge, great location”
Reviews.Author: Travler54
Reviews.Content: We found the concierge who was there most of the time to be very unfriendly and unhelpful. The one restaurant that was recommended by the hotel was awful. And, we didn't even know that there was a rooftop terrace until looking at these reviews after having already been there!! Location is terrific. The breakfast was very good. The air conditioning in our room did not work well at all. They charge for use of internet. Would probably recommend the hotel if the price were reasonable, but would also recommend not counting on the staff for any direction or information.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families...”
Reviews.Author: frazzledinptc
Reviews.Content: I agree with everything that has been said about the location, views, loveliness of the rooms. I do want to add that the air conditioning in our room worked better than any other place we stayed in Italy. Also, since finding suitable, reasonable accomodations for families can be difficult, I wanted to address that issue. We have 2 children (10 and 13) that we wanted to have in the same room with us, but who wanted separate beds, and the Locanda Vivaldi was able to accomodate us with that. Our room, which faced the lagoon, had a large double bed and two single beds, without seeming overly cramped. We booked at the hotel because they offered that bed configuration, but having stayed there, I would recommend the hotel to anyone, with or without children, without hesitation. When we checked in, we were given a voucher for a free aperitivo on the rooftop terrace that afternoon. It was great way to unwind after a long day of travel and they offered the kids an orange juice along with our drinks. I didn't see other children there while we were there, but they hotel staff was very welcoming of ours.

Reviews.Title: “More than exceeded my expecations”
Reviews.Author: ochw
Reviews.Content: My husband, my two teens and I stayed here for three nights in early June and found the hotel to be charming, very well located and a comfortable place to find refuge from the huge crowds in Venice. We had connecting rooms with a view of the canal and a terrace with a view of the open water. Our terrace was a shady and relaxing place to enjoy a bottle of Proseco or to just watch the world go by. The rooms were very clean and well cared for and the bathrooms spacious and modern. The a/c worked well. Views from the rooftop terrace were breathtaking and the bartender very friendly and attentive. Breakfast was served in two cute rooms crammed with too many small tables that made the already hot room seem way too crowded. The food was fresh and delicious with the best hot chocolate I've ever had. The Vivaldi has its own private dock for water taxis that made it very convenient for arrivals and departures. My only criticism was that the two concierges were impatient and seemed bored when answering our many questions. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ThewrightsManchester
Reviews.Content: Wow- what more can I say except thankyou Locanda Vivaldi for making our anniversary perfect. We had a corner room wih a lagoon view it was superb. The terrace for evening drinks "what a view." Breakfasts lovely. All the staff we met were friendly and polite. so I would hihgly reccommend this hotel. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “great location in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: gilesopito
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our Ruby Wedding Anniversary. It was very easy to find arriving at the San Zaccaria stop just down from St Marks Square, not far to walk with the cases. Staff were very good,room was nice but bathroom a bit small.It was very expensive but so is everything in Venice. Would love to come back to Venice and to this hotel but not sure that we would spend that money again. It is a good choice for a special occassion.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Beautiful and Romantic- wish i was back!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel26
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property twice. The first time was with a friend and the whole time I was wishing I was here with my significant other. The second time I came was with my husband. There is absolutely not one thing I could find about this place that would be negative. The rooms are gorgeous, the views remarkable and location can't be beat. The breakfast in the morning is delicious and the staff there is friendly and very accomodating. (especially to visitors from USA). I have also stayed at the Danieli and I didn't enjoy it as much as I did there. Danieli is just too touristy and pricey. I don't suggest this hotel if you are traveling with children. Its just too beautiful and romantic and the whole time you will be wishing that you had left them at hom

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Welcoming Inn on the Venice Lagoon”
Reviews.Author: TraveljunkieFLA
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently spent 2 nights at this warm and welcoming hotel in Venice. We reserved one standard double room and the Junior Suite with the large terrace. From the moment of our arrival at the hotel, the staff was gracious and helpful. They provided excellent recommendations for off-the-beaten path dining and shopping options. The rooms were clean and elegantly furnished. The hotel itself was also clean and well-appointed. Breakfast was served in two charming rooms located near the back of the hotel. There was a good selection of food and the staff was always quick to serve beverages and re-fill empty plates. The hotel's location is also perfect. It is close enough to St Mark's Square while still being far enough away to avoid some of the crowds right around the square. Two added benefits of this hotel are the rooftop terrace which overlooks the lagoon and the beautiful walkway in front of the hotel which is particularly nice in the evening when most of the day-time tourists have left the area for the day.

Reviews.Title: “mark's wedding at the locanda vivaldi”
Reviews.Author: lexspenc2
Reviews.Content: I went to the Locanda Vivaldi last september for my best friend's wedding. We book 6 rooms, 2 of them with view on the lagoon, 3 standard with no view and one junior suite: all rooms were very clean, the service was perfect and the staff was nice. Breakfast in the morning was delicious and lunch for mark's wedding reception in the restaurant on the roof top terrace was great. The view from this small beautiful hotel and from its terrace is unforgetable. they should have internet wireless instead of the internet point in the lobby...but when you are in venice you don-t care a lot about surfing the net... :) excluding that everything was really perfect. nice experience!

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rosa2256
Reviews.Content: I loved to stay at this beautiful charming boutique hotel! nothing more to say! just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Locanda Vivaldi”
Reviews.Author: Sue020
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a delightful stay at the Locanda Vivaldi, 24-28 December 2008. Our lagoon view double was spotlessly clean and very comfortable with, of course, a wonderful view. We had no problems at all with the noise mentioned by some other reviewers - even without closing the shutters. All the hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and perhaps are the hotel's greatest assets. Nothing was too much trouble and everyone seemed genuinely happy to have us staying. On the negative side, breakfast was a bit hit and miss - the eggs and bacon were best avoided - but a plentiful supply of excellent fresh bread, cold meats and cheese compensated. We were not too keen on the piped English Christmas music in the lobby and breakfast room, but no doubt this was meant as a welcoming gesture for English guests. These two minor niggles in no way detracted from a wonderful stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Vivaldi suits us perfectly”
Reviews.Author: Clavis
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Vivaldi three times in successive years & consider it perfect. Its main selling point is of course the view - possibly one of the best in the world â€“ across the Lagoon to San Giorgio Maggiore Marvellous ! Who wants to overlook a narrow, dark (& sometimes noisy) canal when you can enjoy such a view as you open the bedroom curtains in the morning â€“ or on your first evening, sit savouring your complimentary bottle of Prosecco ? The beds are comfortable, the bathrooms well-equipped - all kept spotless by the room staff The dining room is bright & warm & the breakfast food is fresh & tasty â€“ with no background music to disturb the meal â€“ in fact, usually, there is no noise anywhere in the hotel, except the low murmur of conversation. The staff are all most welcoming, friendly & efficient â€“ especially the genial porters & the two knowledgeable receptionists, whose unobtrusive attention to detail is remarkable. On our last visit one of the receptionists ordered a water taxi to take us to the airport The following day, whilst we waited in the lounge, his colleague, noticed that the taxi was slightly (very slightly) late. Without any prompting from us, he rang the taxi office, made enquiries about what was happening &, when he received an unsatisfactory answer, made a fresh booking elsewhere. That's service ! Luckily we had allowed plenty of time. We could recommend the Vivaldi to anyone We intend to be back again in 2009 for visit number four

Reviews.Title: “Sweets on the bed”
Reviews.Author: Margarette_8
Reviews.Content: We were in Venice for a week to celebrate my birthday. I selected this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed. Easy to find, just turn right along the waterfront after getting off the Vaporetta at San Zaccaria and it is just 2-3 minutes. We arrived at night. A nice touch, the vaporetta operator turnedoff the centre lights as we passed St Mark's Square and Doges Palace so we had a lovely first view. We had a comfortable, clean, room with a side canal view. Room servicing was excellent, twice a day as far as we know, and unobtrusive, except for our last day when we somehow managed to meet our charming chambermaid 3 times!! Good variety at breakfast and very helpful staff. View from roof terrace is wonderful. As for Venice itself. We had 7 day Venice Travel cards which we used a lot, - a must. We try to find reasonable local eating places when in foreign cities. Venice defeated us some days. However Osteria da Baco, in a street somewhere behind the Hotel Danieli, has fresh homemade sandwiches, and other snacks, reasonably priced. We had good food in Trattoria Sara on Sz Greci, just before a bridge. We were not automatically given the tourist menu, displayed outside, when we sat down, we had to ask for it. We also enjoyed a pizzeria, Al Vecio Canton, in narrow streets at the end of Calle Rota. The Billa Supermarket along the waterfront at Zattere, has fresh sandwiches and there are seats along the waterfront. Beer drinkers be warned, - very expensive in Venice, in all the bars and cafes we tried.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay, very nice staff!!”
Reviews.Author: STEMP
Reviews.Content: We booked a three nights stay in a Superior Double Room at Hotel Locanda Vivaldi in Venice. It was not our first time in the city, but first experience in this hotel. It is just marvellous! The view from the room was stunning, and the room itself was very comfortable, well cleaned and keept. A very big thank you to all the staff of this hotel! Everyone was very friendly and helpfull, the concierge knows the city very well and he can give you A LOT of usefull information. I would definitely suggest this hotel to everyone who want to spend some great day in the fabulous city of Venice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location....but”
Reviews.Author: Stan46
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Locanda Vivaldi September 29-October 3. The hotel has a great location if your are visiting Venice. However, the staff was not the least bit acommodating when we had a problem with the air conditioning and mosquitoes. It looks like this hotel turns off the airconditioning at the end of September but Venice can still be quite warm and uncomfortable. It was impossible to keep the windows open because of the mosqiitoes. Make sure that the A/C is still working when choosing a hotel if you travel to Venice at the end of September and the beginning of October.

Reviews.Title: “Locanda Vivaldi - great home base”
Reviews.Author: Madey
Reviews.Content: Website & reviews don't say enough about the rooftop terrace. It's a fantastic perch to sit upon in morning & evening, providing a private spot (with a great view) from which to people watch. We had it all to ourselves during our 2 night stay, and both nights a (very friendly) staff member made a cheese plate with fresh fruit & biscuits to snack on while enjoying a bottle of wine. If you're an early riser (or adjusting to the time change), bring a cup of coffee up there in the morning & catch the sunrise. Room was very clean; breakfast delicious & more than plentiful. For budget conscious: location can't be beat if you plan to use water bus instead of springing for private taxi. Other hotels may seem an easy walk from vaporetto stop, but the winding alleys, footbridges & cobblestones can make for a miserable trek if you're carrying luggage. Really don't need to pay extra for a room w/view - ours was at the very back of hotel but overlooked a charming canal & footbridge. Will defintely return if we're lucky enough to return to beautiful Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mills15
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Locanda Vivaldi for two nights at the end of August. We chose this hotel because of the location and reviews and we were not disappointed in any way! The hotel was really easy to find, just up a bit from the waterbus station outside St Marks Square. Check in was very quick and our luggage was taken up to our room for us. The receptionist spoke excellent English and gave us a map of Venice, pointing out all of the major tourist attractions. I had emailed the hotel a few days prior to arrival requesting a twin room with a view. I was told that I would have to chose one or the other as all rooms with views contained double beds only. We chose to go with the twin room expecting to have a room at the back overlooking a courtyard as told to us so we were very pleasantly surprised to be told on arrival that they were now able to accomodate us in a twin room overlooking the side canal along with views towards the lagoon - very beautiful! The room was not particulary large but was very beautifully decorated and had a seating area. The bathroom was spotless and had a sauna shower which was very nice. It took a while to work out how to use the sauna but when we did get it working it was superb. The only complaint we had with the room was that the air conditioning was not adequate to cool the room sufficiently, it was 35 degrees each day. We did report it and were told that somebody would look at it but we are not sure if they did or not, it certainly didn't improve during our visit! Breakfast selection was superb with plenty of choices with both a hot and cold selection and a very efficient waitress supplying hot drinks. Reception staff were very helpful and when I asked them to make a telephone call on my behalf confirming a tour I had booked independantly, they were more than happy to do it. Location of this hotel could not have been better, we were 3 or 4 min walk from St Marks Square where you could hop on to a number of waterbuses to take you all over Venice. All in all, I would certainly recommend this hotel. It isn't cheap but then Venice isn't cheap and you do get what you pay for in this hotel coupled by the fabulous location!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: MillenniumBiltmorePR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Locanda Vivaldi last year for a night before meeting up with some friends in Umbria - I chose it based on the traveler reviews and the pictures on the website, and I was both relieved and delighted to find they were all perfectly accurate. My time in Venice was on my own so I wanted a hotel I could easily find by myself after getting off the vaporetto - it was literally a 2-minute walk from the Alilaguna stop, so the location was convenient and easy. St. Mark's is just a bridge or two away! Everyone at the hotel was delightful - from the front desk to the bellman to the managers to the breakfast staff. They handled all my luggage, re-keyed my room immediately when my key de-magnitized one morning and even held my suitcases for about 6 hours AFTER I checked out so I could wander around the city before my train left for Perugia. They were extremely friendly and helpful - couldn't have asked for better service! The bed was extremely comfortable, the room looked out over a gorgeous courtyard with flowers and stained-glass windows and a canal off to one side, the bathroom was impeccably clean and large with lots of counterspace, and the furnishings were traditionally Venetian (I got the room shown on the website with the pink interior). The breakfast, included in the rate, was ample and delicious. As a hotelier myself sometimes I find I can be picky about rooms, but I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quaint and quiet boutique hotel, no question! It will really make your entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous”
Reviews.Author: rsimmons342002
Reviews.Content: My five days in Venice at this boutique hotel was the best. From the free trip to Murano via Water taxi to the accommodations presented by the staff, it was a very memorable experience

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for the US President!”
Reviews.Author: Wendywombat4
Reviews.Content: My partner had arranged a surprise 50th birthday treat for me. What a treat too! This hotel is gorgeous, great location, fabulous suite, friendly staff, in fact everything about this hotel is excellent! The rooftop terrace is a delightful place to sit and just watch the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “Small and almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: dands38
Reviews.Content: This is not a grande hotel by any means but what they do they do very well. Lovely helpful staff, spotlessley clean. We had our towels changed twice a day and the pillowcases every day this was most welcome in the August heat!. We booked 2 rooms one standard which was a few feet from a brick wall! It was no problem when we asked to change. The other room was a superior and faced the lagoon. It was a beautiful view, but be warned this is a very busy waterway and street and therefore noisy ,but there was always plenty to look at including the odd ocean liner going past your window! Stay here if you like good quality unpretentious hotels. In a great position 5 mins from St Marks square and a few yards up from the Danielli.

Reviews.Title: “I love italian capucino!!”
Reviews.Author: KarenGray
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Locanda Vivaldi for 4 nights by the end of July first days of august: I really like this Hotel! Room was very clean and bright full and every afternoon they left you a small chocolate on your pillow and weather forecast for the day after. We didnâ€™t book a frontal double superior with view on the lagoon, but our standard room has a nice view on a side canal Rio di Grecci and we could partially see the lagoon and the Salute Churchâ€¦very nice! Breakfast is delicious: eggs, ham, cheese, fresh bread and toast, marmalade, pastries, cakes, cereals, yogurtâ€¦everything! And the capucinoâ€¦mmmâ€¦I love Italian capucino! All the staff at reception is very kind, at check-in time they spend more than 15 minutes with us explaining what to visit in the city and answering at all our question: we got a free map of the city and a small book, guest in Venice, full of information about everything: museum, transportation, music, churches, imetables, historyâ€¦everything! They also arrange for us for train tickets to go to Florence, without asking us any extra fee or commission. Very nice is also the terrace on the third floor: we had aperitif there with the most beautiful view you can imagine! We will definitely come backâ€¦thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: sg_mariposa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Locanda Vivaldi last July, for a vey special event: the marriage of my very best friend! We were a small group of 14, but only 6 of us booked a room in this beautiful Hotel: we all reserved double superior room with Jacuzzi and view on the lagoon. From our rooms we can see the Lido island, Saint George island, the Salute Church and the Doge Palace and the famous church tower. Saint Mark square is really close to the Hotel, only a few minutes walking. Every day we had a delicious breakfast in the nice breakfast room on the ground floor and all the staff was always very kind with all of us. My friend got married in the beautiful Palazzo Cavalli, then we reach Saint Mark square by Gondola and after we took pictures we went back to the Locanda Vivaldi. Here she organized her wedding reception on the wonderful rooftop terrace of the Locanda Vivaldi: this is not a big terrace but itâ€™s the ideal place for a private party for 15-20 person, here they also have restaurant service in summer time, but only for dinner. The view from the Terrace is fabulous and we really enjoy the lunch especially prepared for her marriage. During our stay in Venice we visited the Peggy Gugenheim Collection, next to the Accademia art Gallery ( this is really fabulous!), the Rialto area and the Ghetto. We follow the suggestions of our foodâ€™s guide book â€œchow!â€� and we went to: la Riveta Restaurant, Il Refolo, the famous La Madona and the one Michelin star Da Fiore. We Loved all of them! Next to Rialto Bridge, close to the market area there are very nice places to have an aperitif with the typical venetian â€œcichetiâ€� (fingerfood) : get a table in front of the Gran Canal! I love Venice in summer timeâ€¦I hope to come back soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trelevan
Reviews.Content: I visited Venice with my husband and our teenage grandaughter in June; we stayed three nights at the Locanda Vivaldi. Our rooms were beautifully decorated and furnished, as is the hotel as a whole. My huband and I had a room overlooking the lagoon which was lovely, our grandaughter was a little dissapointed that her room overlooked a bit of garden. This hotel is ideally situated to visit St Marks and most of the essential sights of Venice; I would have no hesitation in recommending it. We especially enjoyed being able to arrive and leave the hotel by water taxi, the turn down service and the breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Locale”
Reviews.Author: gwporsche
Reviews.Content: We were able to book this wonderful hotel ourselves. We had a party of four with 2 teenage boys and were able to add a rollaway in the second bedroom-a bit tight, but certainly hotel was very accommodating of our needs. Very clean and in excellent physical condition. Location is perfect-very close to St. Mark's Square and other landmarks. Very nice breakfast buffet in morning and evening reception on rooftop with great view. We would highly recommend to all kinds of travelers! We actually booked based on Trip Advisor ratings and reviews, so thanks!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Locanda Vivaldi is a gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: marymollymaggie
Reviews.Content: Just back from Venice with an 18 and 23 year old. We stayed at this wonderful hotel directly on the Grand Canal and just 500 yards from Piazza San Marco for 2 nights and enjoyed every minute. Locanda Vivaldi has it's own dock so very convenient for the motoscafo {water taxi} to deliver you right to the front door. Beware that the motoscafo are very expensive; $65 euro from the train station and 95 euro to the airport, but a special treat arriving in style! The hotel staff is very helpful and friendly. The breakfast is served in a lovely room on the main floor and is complete with bacon and eggs along with cereals, juices, cheese and fruit. The hotel has a lovely covered terrace on the top floor for boat and people watching along the canal. Our room had a balcony and it made the already beautifully decorated and comfortable room that much more special. The hotel is immaculate and the service first rate. We did not have dinner here with so many wonderful restaurants near by. One that I highly recommend is one that many contributors have already recommended and that is Trattoria della Rivetta, just a 6 or 7 minute walk from the hotel. It is a favorite of the gondoliers and it's no surprise as the food is delicious and the staff very friendly. Another restaurant that I often patronize in Venice is MADONNA, on the other side of the Rialto Bridge, down the second calle "alley" on the left. Very good seafood, friendly waiters. We also visited the Peggy Guggenheim Collezione in Dorsoduro, a short walk from the Accademia Bridge with a wonderful collection of modern art; including Picasso, Jackson Pollack, Dali, Calder, Henry Moore and many others. The people of Venice know that their #1 industry is tourism and treat visitors very kindly, especially if one makes the simple effort with buon giorno and grazia!

Reviews.Title: “The Real Venice”
Reviews.Author: MarkLeicester
Reviews.Content: Okay- lets be honest! Venice is one of the most expensive locations on the planet. If you understand this from the begining and adjust your sights accordingly- you can stiil enjoy one of the truly great cities of the world. Locanda Vivaldi generates great debate- on the whole most people love it. It is close to the centre of the city- with some of the most fabulous views you will find. You can pay several times the room rate at more well known hotels along the Grand Canal- only to find inadequate room size and no view at all. This hotel is value for money based on its competition. My wife and I have stayed here many times over the last few years. If you cannot enjoy this hotel- you will not like Venice and you might as well stay at home. The hotels only failing is the breakfast selection- so what! Go out and enjoy what this city has to offer. The staff are fantastic and welcoming (particularly Stefano). I am not going to say what is the best room to book- I dont want to lose it to others. However- I suggest that you splash out and book a room at the front- and you can then lean out and enjoy this vibrant & sometimes noisy city at its best. Learn to enjoy the italian part of your soul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vivaldi1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Locanda Vivaldi is a first class hotel in a amazing location on the Gan Canal. It 's just few steps from St. Marks, and is also in front to the main vaporetto stops. Our rooms were a nice size had a view over the Gran Canal. The furnishings are greats and the room was elegant and confortable. The breakfast buffet was excellent, and the terrace bar had a nice view on St. Mark basin. The front desk staff were very friendly, professional and helpful. We would return ti this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel, loads of charm”
Reviews.Author: coppersheen
Reviews.Content: Had four nights at the lovely Locanda Vivaldi with my husband. Hotel is very charming, small, boutique style with typical Venetian furnishings - fabric wall coverings, glass chandelier etc. Our room, number 106, was spacious (especially for European hotel) with a reasonable size well appointed bathroom. It is a corner room so you get four sets of windows making it very light and airy. Room 206 would be the same. Great views over the water. The hotel is less than three minutes walk along the waterfront to San Marco Square, fantastic location. As it is right on the waterfront, there are large numbers walking by during the day so there is some noise but by evening this has dropped off enormously and becomes very quiet. There is no restaurant at the hotel but there are numbers of restaurants very close by. No hardship at all. Breakfast was very good - plenty of choice, and always eggs plus the usual continental fare. Water taxi comes direct to the hotels own steps and staff very friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay at this hotel again (and we've stayed in many 5 star hotels so don't say it lightly)

Reviews.Title: “Loved Locanda Vivaldi!”
Reviews.Author: Alex146
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Locanda Vivaldi early March 2008 for four nights. We cannot speak highly enough of the hotel. We booked directly with the hotel and this was really easy, with prompt replies to our e mails, confirming rates and arrangements for getting to the hotel from Marco Polo Airport. The hotel is a beautiful building in an excellent location,spotlessly clean and all staff were unfailing friendly and helpful. It was very cold during our stay in Venice and it was great to come back to a lovely warm room each evening. The hotel's landing stage meant we were able to arrive and leave by water taxi. Expensive, really worth it and great fun! We looked forward to the excellent breakfast every morning. Our room (202) had a fantastic view over the lagoon. We enjoyed watching all the comings and goings on the lagoon. Along with the turn down service each night and the little chocolate sweets on our pillows, it was really useful to get the hotel's little card with the next day's weather forecast. Based on our experience of the hotel we highly recommend Locando Vivaldi.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly devine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kinoko
Reviews.Content: The Locanda Vivaldi is absolutely devine. It is a charming hotel in a superb location. We took my parents as a thank you present and we booked the 2 bedroom suite ( 420 ) which was beautiful. Two large bedrooms with interconnecting door and each with it's own large bathroom. We had a small balcony with 4 chairs and a table which overlooked an idyllic canal. Breakfast is good, served in a nice dining room in winter but on a lovely terrace in the summer. Definately worth, in our opinion, splashing out on a water taxi to and from airport ( 100 euro each way ) it really makes a lovely start and finish to your visit to the beautiful Venice. Ask the Concierge to direct you to the Trattoria Alla Rivetta, great food, fantastic service and wonderful atmosphere, although it is so popular you may have to wait a little while for a table we think it is worth it ( closed on Monday ). Hope you have a lovely stay. The Sheffield Family.

Reviews.Title: “best Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Nora77
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I've been in Italy! I've been twice in Venice but it was my first time in this small charming Hotel and for sure I will come back!!! what to say, it was simply perfect: perfect location, really easy to reach and with a wonderful view on st.mark basin, just beshide San Mark square!!! I booked for a double superior room, but the concierge upgrade us to A junior suite without any charge! I stayed in the red junior suite with the private terrace...and I relly felt like the most luky guest in the entire Hotel...what a room! what a view!!! really WOW! Brakfast was great, service is really good and everybody there are nice and very polite. We did also have the free tour to Murano island and I bought a wonderful blowed glass vase. I relly enjoy my stay, thank you Locanda Vivaldi!!! see you soon

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: dormar00
Reviews.Content: Dear Friend, Please believe me when I say that this small charming hotel is really a surprise. The location is unbeateble, in the heart of the city, just 200 meters from Saint Mark's Square. The building is overlooking the lagoon and the small canal beside the hotel, where they have also a private taxi landing. Very easy to reach it from the airport, just a 40 minutes ride with the boat! The rooms are incredible, pretty big for Europe average, very well keept, clean, clear and with that particular touch that make them so personal and different form the other ones. We booked a superior double overlooking the lagoon directly on the property web site, they give us a good deal and they have been very helpfull. It was our first time in enice and the receptionist gave us a lot of usefull information. The breakfast is very good, basically a continental breakfast, a classic for Italy, but also with eggs, cheese, ham and salami. The waiters were very kind and pleasant, a plus. To be honest the whole staff is very kind and pleasant, these guys know their job! Whatelse to say, try it, you will be impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: CathyandMike
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Locanda Vivaldi for Christmas 2007 and it was wonderful. We contacted the hotel via their website to book - i made two inquiries and the two quotes I received were VASTLY different, so I replied to the cheaper one and booked. We got a superior double room with Lagoon views (which was on the 2nd floor) and it was fantastic. The rooms looked directly across to the Lido. The rooms are beautiful - the extra touches like slippers, bathrobes and bath salts (good after a long day of walking) are wonderful. The rooms are temperature controlled, with control panels next to the bed. The cleaning staff do a great job - everything felt and was spotless. The room had a safe, and wardrobes, it was everything you needed, and more. The hotel has a lift, though hotel staff did bring our bags to our room. The hotel itself is 3 blocks (or two canal bridges) away from Piazzo San Marco - so you can never get lost. The breakfast is lovely, fresh fruit, cereals, pastries, cakes, meats and cheeses etc - the coffee is to be lamented, but I think it stood out as everything else was so good. The staff are knowledgeable and anything you need to know the staff are happy to answer or to assist. The hotel does not have internet access, but there is an internet cafe not too far away. We had a wonderful and relaxing time, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Locanda Vivaldi is a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonyRomeReading
Reviews.Content: My wife and I first stayed at the Locanda Vivaldi for our 25th Wedding Anniversary 3 years ago. We have returned for our Wedding Anniversary every year since (four times in total) and are already looking forward to the next time. The staff are all extremely helpful and friendly and it is a pleasure to be there. The hotel has an excellent location and the lagoon view from some of the rooms is stunning. We cannot imagine ever staying anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small Hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: alene_brown
Reviews.Content: ITALY...what a wonderful country! " il belo paese!' During my trip I visted Rome, Florence and Venice. I loved Venice!!! I stayed at Locanda Vivaldi: this is a small four stars Hotel really closed to St. Mark Square. The Hotel is facing the bacin and if you book a superior room you will have a wonderful view in front of the see, the " Lagune di Venezia". I booked a standard room and I had a view on the side canal and partly on the bacin, but it was nice. Breakfast in the morning is good: no bacon, but plenty of pastry, cookies, fresh bread, eggs, cheese, ham, fresh fruit...pratically everythings...but no bacon!!! anyway that' s typicol italian! The staff was very friendly with us and they suggest us what to visit and where to go for dinner. We went to "Fiaschetteria Toscana" not far from Rialto bridge and it was really good. Next year I will come back to Italy and probably to Venice too. If so I will choose this small and lovely Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: annalinthaichin
Reviews.Content: wonderful location , just 5 minutes from saint mark square. ery friendly staff and clean hotel. Breakfast was excellent and Amedeo the one who take care about us at breakfast time is very very nice boy! he is asian like me! this is a 4 star hotel and not a 3 star like tripadvisor show on the review. i loved the flowers! Venice is a magic city and food there is really special. we went to DA FIORE restaurant near campo san polo, the best one in town and we had wonderful meal. we also went to DA FRANZ by suggestion of the hotel staff and it was really good. for a good italian pizza and cousine don't miss the REFOLO near campo san giacomo. there I met a lot of young asian people ans lot of venetian student. it was so funny!!! the hotel offer us also a free tour to murano island, nice experience! i"will surley come back! my parents loved Locanda vivaldi too! thanks to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: rhkfreespirit
Reviews.Content: Based on the mixed reviews about this hotel, we took our travel agent's recommendation with some trepidation. However, we just came back from staying at the Locanda Vivaldi for three nights and it was absolutely wonderful. The staff is extremely attentive and the hotel is immaculate and charming. This was the former home of the composer Vivaldi so that the rooms are "European" style/smaller than typical American hotels and bathrooms are functional and adequate. We had reserved a canal view room which was incredible...we had a "Juliet balcony" overlooking the grand canal and looking out at a side view of San Marco square/Camponile and the Doge's Palace. Although noisy during the day, at night it was quiet. We had pre-arranged via email with the hotel to reserve a "Secret tour" in English of the Doge's Palace (as recommended by others on Trip Advisor who had visited Venice) and the hotel was very accommodating in providing that help for us emailing us with our confirmation number. They also made provisions for us to have a water taxi meet us at the airport to transport us to their own dock! Expensive but very worth it (since we saw so many people lugging luggage up and down the canal bridges to get to their hotels!!) We were taking a cruise from Venice and they made arrangements for a water taxi to take us directly to the ship which made the transfer of luggage extremely easy. They have a very nice breakfast buffet in a lovely breakfast room and a computer with internet for guests to use in the lobby for a nominal fee. We would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to all who want to be in the prime area on San Marco/Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: fairycakeEngland
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Venice. The hotel is well situated and easy to find. It is tastefully decorated to a high standard and the rooms are kept cleaner than some 5* English ones I've stayed in. The continental breakfasts cater for most appetites. What impressed me most was the helpfulness of ALL of the hotel staff - nothing was too much trouble and they went out of their way to meet our needs. I think the staff are a real asset to the hotel and have the difficult job of trying to understand most of their customers who don't even attempt a few words of Italian. We didn't request a room with a lagoon view and therefore could not be disappointed when our room did not have such a view - but at the end of the day, Venice is set on canals and waterways, just outside the hotel - it didn't spoil our holiday one bit as we spent very little time in the hotel room. The roof terrace was great at night and the views were breathtaking. I would certainly recommend this hotel and will use it on my next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Mondak
Reviews.Content: It wasn't easy to find a hotel in Venice, in the summer, for our family of four, but we were extremely happy with this hotel. We found it through Trip Advisor, which is how we found every hotel on our two week trip. The Locanda Vivaldi is right on the Grand Canal, just a bridge or two past the Danieli from St. Mark's, and has beautiful views over the water from some rooms and from the rooftop terrace. The rooms were large and family rooms are available, they are decorated beautifully and the bathrooms are modern. The terrace is open for drinks and dinner, and throughout the day and night is left available for guests to use at will. The service was adequate but certainly not friendly, but the hotel itself and the lcoation made this an excellent stay, and we would recommend it to anyone going to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: UKTravellerStHelens
Reviews.Content: The Locanda Vivaldi's best feature is its location on Riva Degli Schiavoni & a 5 minute strole to San Marco. Our room faced the lagoon & was clean & nicely furnished. There's a turn down service, slippers, robes & a nightly weather forcast. The air conditioning kept the room to a sleepable temperature for a North European despite daytime temperatures of 30C. You are right opposite the San Zaccaria ferry stop which is great for getting around. Venice is not a late night city so the bustle & noise from the boats eases off after about 23.00. The 3rd floor terrace was used as a combined bar (open at 16.00) & restaurant (open at 19.30) when we were there. The Gritti bar was not open during our stay. There's a decent breakfast selection - cereals, scrambled egg, bread rolls, cheese, ham, salami, fruit, yoghurt, cake, bicuits, croisants, jams. We didn't try the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Best room in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Stubdoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Locanda Vivaldi for 3 days and had a wonderful time. The location is prime, just a short walk from St. Mark's Square. We did pay for a lagoon-view room, and our room opened right onto the Riva degli Schiavoni, the main waterfront walk. The view was fantastic, although, as expected, noisy. There is a motorized shutter to close out the commotion if desired. The room was beautiful, clean, spacious, and comfortable, and the staff was very nice to us, especially Anna, who greeted us and gave us directions and suggestions immediately upon our arrival. She spoke with us every day while we were there and made us feel at home; we have even kept up a correspondence with her. The other staff helped with dinner and concert reservations. Breakfast was lovely with very pleasant waitstaff. The hotel has an arrangement with one of the Murano glass factories and has a water taxi take you right from the hotel to Murano for free, and guide you through the factory and showroom. This was a welcome service, so as to avoid the crowds. We could not have been more pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by the Locanda Vivaldi”
Reviews.Author: newburygal
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying at this hotel and can honestly say I was slightly disappointed. My room was in an annexe with a view of the wall of the building next door. In addition as a result of my plane taking off 50 minutes later than scheduled and making my connecting flight with minutes to spare, my suitcase failed to arrive till the following day. I explained this on my arrival at the hotel but there was no offers of complimentary toothpaste or toothbrush or any suggestions as to where I could purchase these. The one good thing about the hotel was the hydro-massage bath. On the whole I found the staff manning the reception to be very standoffish and not very friendly. If I ever do return to Venice I will certainly choose a different hotel

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: sachuest
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a paris, venice , florence trip. Loved all of the hotels that we stayed at except this one. Had booked a lagoon room view, and upon arrival, received a room with a view on the first floor. We had to crouch down to change if the window was open because everyone could see in. The noise level was ridiculous, from the people right outside our window, to the boats arriving constantly. The room was too hot with the windows closed, and the mosquitoes were interesting with the windows open. I asked for a room change the minute I saw it, as I knew immediatley that it was going to be too loud. I stated that I would be happy to accept one without a view . The receptionist told me that I should check in the morning as there was nothing available. I spoke with a genteman at breakfast the following morning and he said he had a quiet room in the back and he was checking out that morning. Again, I went to the reception desk and was told that there would be no ohter rooms avaiable for our entire stay. Staff in the breakfast room were nice, and the breakfast was fine. The hair dryer did not work ( I didn't dare ask about that!). No concierge, and the staff was annoyed if you asked for dinner reservations. Don't even bother about directions! It certainly put a damper on our venice experience, they certainly do not see to care about their clients. I would definately seek another hotel! r.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cynwhitte
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at this Hotel celebrating our 20th Anniversary. We made a really Good Choice.The hotel location was Fantastic. The Locanda Vivaldi is located just 2 blocks from St. Mark's Square, an excellent location,overlooking the Lagoon. You can see the Hotel as you are coming into the city from the Boat Ride making it very easy to locate. Our Experience here was Enjoyable. Upon check in we found out we had a room without a view, however we requested an upgrade which was Gladly honored, except, we did have to pay an extra $70 euros a night for this upgrade. But the extra charge was well worth it. We received a room with a view of the Lagoon, 2 large windows and a Nice Jacuzzi whirlpool tub. The Room was very nice and was well stocked with all the needed ammenities. Exactly what we had hoped for. We found the staff pretty good. When we came down the first morning and requested coffee, before the breakfast room had opened it was given to us without any complaints and at no charge. However,when we returned in the afternoon and asked about a cup of coffee, we were informed it would be at a charge, and also when we asked about using the computer in the lobby,was informed again there was a charge for that as well. (this was all from a different hotel clerk than the one in the morning that had given us the free coffee.) For the price we paid for our room, we do feel these simple requests should of been honored at no charge.(It would of been in the US). Breakfast here was the best on our trip, which included Florence and Rome. really nice and again good service. Other than Coffee seeming to be a commodity in all of ITALY. We Loved Venice and our trip to Italy and will hopefully return. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a really nice stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: TripAdv100
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 4th visit to Venice, first time at Locanda Vivaldi. I was concerned after reading some of the reviews posted here. However, we had a perfect stay at Vivaldi. We specifically reserved a superior deluxe room with a view of St Mark's Basin. We received the room we requested, and it was wonderful. Clean, spacious, with all modcons and ample storage space, and even turn-down service, to our surprise. LocVivaldi provides a very nice continental breakfast buffet with a bit more variety than most. With only 2 or 3 tables occupied each morning, we had excellent serviceâ€”a distinct advantage of traveling off-season. We interacted with at least 3 members of the Reception staff, incl Stefano, who were all completely helpful, competent, and professional. We requested local information a few times and restaurant reservations, all of which were handled perfectly. Every encounter with the hotel staff was mutually courteous, incl housekeeping, reception, breakfast room service, and the bar. (The bartender is very friendly.) We were quite impressed with Locanda Vivaldi. This will certainly be our first choice for our next stay in La Serenissima.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: alimoon
Reviews.Content: this hotel was wonderful, centric location, right on the Grand Canal by the Bridge of Sighs. the breakfast was magnificent, everything you can imagine. we had a great room (suite) we didn't have a view of the canal, but for the time spent in the room it didn't matter. you walked right outside the door and there it was. What a view. we also had a jacuzzi tub with all the whistles, all amenities in the bathroom. everyone was helpful and extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “would not suggest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My review is based largely on the staff. In particular Stefano the manager of the hotel is largely to blame for my poor review. In reality with the exception of Stefano and his horrid performance my review might have been very different. Never in my life have I been treated so horribly by a staff member at any establishment. After we checked in for 3 nights we were told by Stefano that our room would most likely be available for only 2 nights and we would have to move to another comparable room without a view. Stafano failed to tell us that the other room was half the size without a bath. My wife packed our bags on the second day and we were moved to the other room. when we returned and saw the room I complained and was told by the front desk that they couldn't understand why Stafano moved us because our original room was still available. The next day on check out before I had a chance to say anything Stafano confronted me called me a liar and said he had never told us the room was comparable he then yelled at me and insulted both my wife and myself. Honestly the man should not be working in the hotel. He ruined what is in essence a ver nice hotel. Unfortunatly he is the manager and therefore has a major affect on the hotel and your stay. Therefore I suggest finding something else. Feel free to write me at my email adress if you need more info.

Reviews.Title: “Venice with two young children (6+9)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the double suite at the Locanda Vivaldi in Venice with my wife a two young children, ages 6 and 9. The room was just spectacular, with a large king size bed and the other connected room, with it's own bathroom and valcony. The location is perfect, just around the corner from St.Mark's square and all bus-boat terminal. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: Kripri
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location but, our standard room was very small. We complained but nothing was done. The bathroom was clean, but the shower was the size of a telephone booth. If you drop the soap you must get out to retrieve it. There was airconditioning but it was inadequate. The breakfast was good and the view from the terrace was beautiful. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh Venice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Phil Cook
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice at 1.15 am in the morning with 3 nights stay at the Vivaldi. When we awoke and discovered where we were we new it would be a great stay. The Vivaldi only added to our enjoyment of Venice with nicely appointed room, excellent reception and sitting room and outstanding breakfast. The garden terrace cafe and bar provided a beautiful outlook across to Isola Di S. Giorgio and the entrance to the Grand Canal and was a pleasant way to finish the day with a coffee or something stronger. We walked everywhere on in Venice and never got tired of its charm. The only small thing was the size of the showers, however a minor detail in such a beautiful hotel. The Venetian glass light fittings added to the ambience.
